targets.Name: Sunnybear
postText: Yikes! Sunnybear is not wearing their helmet the correct way. It’s too far back. If they fall off their bike they might hurt a very important part of their brain. Let’s fix it.

That’s better! It is important to wear our helmet the correct way every time we ride our bikes. The front of the helmet should sit about two fingers width above your eyebrows. Did you see how Sunnybear checked to make sure it was in the right spot?
targets.hint: I'm soft but shed all over
Text: FURRY PET (Ex: Dogs, Cats, Hamsters, Guinea Pigs, and Rabbits) are common pet allergens that can trigger asthma symptoms in some people.Pet hair and dander, especially cat hair, can fly in the air and land on surfaces throughout the house...

targets.Name: Musicbear
postText: Uh no! Musicbear is hanging their helmet from their bike handles instead of wearing it on their head.
Remember, our seat belts and helmets only work if we wear them and buckle them correctly!
targets.hint: I'm soft but shed all over
Text: FURRY PET (Ex: Dogs, Cats, Hamsters, Guinea Pigs, and Rabbits) are common pet allergens that can trigger asthma symptoms in some people.Pet hair and dander, especially cat hair, can fly in the air and land on surfaces throughout the house...

targets.Name: Flowerbear
postText: Yes! Flowerbear is wearing their helmet the right way.

We can remind friends and family to wear their helmet the right way just like Flowerbear. And before you ride, you can shake your head and make sure the helmet does not wiggle, just like Flowerbear did.
